name: volitional
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
acting as a result of a decision or choice; done because someone has decided or chosen to do it: mental processes over which we have volitional control The action is not mechanical; it is volitional.
More examplesFewer examplesThe complaints alleged volitional acts rather than accidental occurrences.The purpose of the insanity defense is to ensure that a criminal sanction is imposed only on those who had the cognitive and volitional capacity to comply with the law.This is a time of life in which you become a volitional consumer as opposed to being dressed by your parents. The first drink may be volitional, but after one becomes addicted, it becomes a compulsion.
